data.title: All 127 Jamie Foxx Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the incredible world of Jamie Foxx as we take a closer look at some of his most memorable movies. From action-packed thrillers to heartwarming comedies, this roundup article…
data.text:
Janice Barnes

·

Follow

47 min read

·

Mar 17, 2024

--

Get ready to dive into the incredible world of Jamie Foxx as we take a closer look at some of his most memorable movies. From action-packed thrillers to heartwarming comedies, this roundup article provides an overview of Foxx’s diverse acting career, ensuring there’s something for every movie lover to enjoy.

1. Toys (1992)

In “Toys” (1992), Robin Williams stars as the hero, a toy designer named Leslie Zevo, who must save his toy company, the heart and soul of his existence, from an impending disaster. When his uncle Leland Zevo (Sir Michael Gambon), a ruthless businessman with twisted intentions, inherits Zevo Toys and starts manufacturing war toys to profit from conflict, instead of creating laughter and joy, the company’s employees and friends join forces to stop him.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

2. The 7th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (1993)

The 7th Annual Soul Train Music Awards, hosted by Natalie Cole, Patti LaBelle, and Luther Vandross, is a captivating musical celebration honoring achievements made by musicians of color in 1992. This star-studded event, featuring a diverse lineup of talented artists, took place on March 9, 1993, in the heart of Los Angeles, California. Embrace the soulful sounds and energy of this unforgettable TV special, where the spirit of unity among African American artists shines brightly.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

3. 26th NAACP Image Awards (1994)

Join the celebration of the 26th NAACP Image Awards, held on January 5th, 1994, as it honors the outstanding achievements of people of color in the entertainment industry during 1993. The prestigious ceremony, hosted by Vicangelo Bulluck and Belma Johnson, commemorates the exceptional contributions made by talented individuals in the realms of music, television, and motion pictures.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

4. The 8th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (1994)

The 8th Annual Soul Train Music Awards, hosted by none other than the legendary Gladys Knight, Patti LaBelle, and Johnny Gill, was an exhilarating celebration of achievements made in 1993 by musicians of color. Held on March 15, 1994 in the vibrant city of Los Angeles, California, the event showcased the immense talent and creativity of African American music artists. With an impressive 2-hour runtime, this TV special brings together some of the most prestigious and influential figures in the music industry.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

5. 2nd Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards (1996)

Experience the magic of the 2nd Annual Soul Train Lady of Soul Awards, a prestigious event celebrating the achievements and talents of African American women in the music industry. Set in the heart of Santa Monica, California, this unforgettable occasion commemorates the contributions of extraordinary artists to the realms of Rhythm and Blues, Jazz, Hip-Hop, and Gospel music. This star-studded event features incredible performances and heartfelt acceptance speeches, as well as touching tributes to the legends that have shaped the landscape of African American music.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

6. The Truth About Cats & Dogs (1996)

The Truth About Cats & Dogs” is a delightful romantic comedy from 1996, directed by Michael Lehmann and written by Audrey Wells. Starring an ensemble cast including Uma Thurman, Janeane Garofalo, and Ben Chaplin, this film masterfully navigates themes of friendship between women, self-esteem, love, and insecurity.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

7. The Great White Hype (1996)

In “The Great White Hype” (1996), Samuel L. Jackson stars as the promoter of a talented African American boxing champion, who believes the time has come for a change. Enter Jeff Goldblum, a rock band-loving white dude who once defeated the champion in a bout at the tender age of 17. Despite his current occupation as a struggling musician, the ex-boxer agrees to come out of retirement to fight the now-slacking champ.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

8. Home Alone 3 (1997)

Home Alone 3" is an action-packed, hilarious adventure featuring an 8-year-old boy named Alex Pruitt living in Chicago. When international spies come to town, seeking a top-secret computer chip hidden in his toy car, Alex must use all his wits to fend them off.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

9. Booty Call (1997)

Booty Call” is a comedic romance from 1997 that follows two best friends, Miles (Jamie Foxx) and Buddy (Tommy Davidson), as they embark on a mission to fulfill their long overdue need for intimacy. Fueled by a thirst for good times and some friendly competition, the duo embarks on a hilarious adventure that takes them through the city’s most unexpected locations, all while trying to avoid any awkward encounters.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

10. Woo (1998)

Woo is a delightful romantic comedy from 1998, starring the ever-charismatic Jada Pinkett Smith and Tommy Davidson. Directed by Daisy von Scherler Mayer and written by David C. Johnson, the film follows the charming and outgoing character Woo as she goes on a blind date with the insecure and straight-laced law clerk Tim.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

11. 1998 MTV Video Music Awards (1998)

Experience the star-studded 1998 MTV Video Music Awards in this high-energy music event! . Immerse yourself in the electrifying performances of superstars like Monica, Arnold, Cher, and Madonna.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

12. The Players Club (1998)

The Players Club” is a dramatic comedy set in the world of strippers and high-stakes club life. LisaRaye McCoy stars as Diamond, a woman who dreams of escaping the seedy strip joint she works in and making a legitimate living. As she navigates through rival strippers and a manipulative boss, she finds herself caught in a catfight with the deadliest of dominatrixes.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

13. 1999 Essence Awards (1999)

Discover a heartwarming celebration of African-American culture and contributions in the 1999 Essence Awards. This captivating TV special, co-hosted by the talented Jamie Foxx and Jada Pinkett Smith, honors remarkable individuals who have made a profound impact on society through their work in education, social policies, public services, and the arts.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

14. Held Up (1999)

In the 1999 comedy “Held Up, “ Michael, played by Jamie Foxx, is set for a romantic getaway with his girlfriend. That is until she dumps him in the middle of the desert.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

15. Any Given Sunday (1999)

Directed by Oliver Stone, “Any Given Sunday” is a gripping drama that delves into the world of modern-day gladiators and those who lead them. Starring an all-star cast, including Al Pacino, Dennis Quaid, and Cameron Diaz, the film presents an intense and unapologetic look into the high-stakes, life-and-death struggles that pervade the realm of American football.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

16. 31st NAACP Image Awards (2000)

Dream. Achieve.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

17. All Jokes Aside (2000)

All Jokes Aside” is a captivating ‘laughumentary’ documentary that delves into the lives of African American stand-up comedians in Hollywood. The film, released in 2000, explores the darker aspects of comedy and the challenges faced by these comedians in a predominantly white industry.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

18. Bait (2000)

Bait” is a 2000 action-packed crime thriller featuring a compelling cast of stars and a gripping plot that will keep viewers on the edge of their seats. Directed by Antoine Fuqua and written by Andrew Scheinman, Adam Scheinman, and Tony Gilroy, this movie follows an ex-con who is brought into the police force to aid in catching a notorious criminal.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

19. 1st Annual BET Awards (2001)

Experience the magic of the first-ever BET Awards, a groundbreaking event celebrating African-American achievements in music, sports, television, and film. Hosted by the dynamic duo of Steve Harvey and Cedric The Entertainer, this unforgettable evening took place on June 19, 2001, at the iconic Paris Las Vegas in Las Vegas, Nevada.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

20. Ali (2001)

Experience the unforgettable life of the legendary Muhammad Ali in the 2001 biographical drama, “Ali. “ This gripping film, which has been nominated for 2 Oscars and boasts an impressive 10 wins and 27 nominations, takes viewers on a journey through Ali’s triumphs and controversies between 1964 and 1974. Featuring an all-star cast, including Will Smith, Jamie Foxx, and Jon Voight, this captivating drama delves into the personal and professional life of the revered sports icon, exploring themes of identity, religion, and the power of perseverance. With a runtime of 2 hours and 37 minutes, “Ali” is a riveting exploration of an iconic figure that transcends sports.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

21. The 44th Annual Grammy Awards (2002)

Experience the magic of music as you witness the 44th Annual Grammy Awards, a star-studded event that celebrates the best talents in the industry. Hosted by the legendary Jon Stewart, this 3-hour extravaganza brings together an impressive lineup of artists and performers, including the captivating Christina Aguilera and the fiery Pink.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

22. It’s Black Entertainment (2002)

It’s Black Entertainment, “ a 2002 documentary film by Stan Lathan, delves into the world of African American musical performers throughout the 20th century. The captivating documentary is divided into several segments, each showcasing the diverse talents of these legendary artists. From the dynamic dance scenes of musical divas to the soulful sounds of jazz and swing, this television special offers a thrilling journey through the evolution of African American music.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

23. The 16th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (2002)

Get ready to celebrate the best of soulful sounds with the 16th Annual Soul Train Music Awards! . Hosted by an all-star lineup including Arsenio Hall, Yolanda Adams, Faith Evans, and Shemar Moore, this iconic awards show honors the achievements of musicians of color in 2001. With an engaging runtime of 3 hours, it’s a night you won’t want to miss as we pay tribute to the incredible music and talent that defined the year.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

24. 33rd NAACP Image Awards (2002)

Join the celebration as Hollywood’s biggest stars come together to honor outstanding achievements made during 2001 by people of color in music, television, and motion pictures. Hosted by the hilarious Chris Tucker, the 33rd NAACP Image Awards ceremony is a glamorous event you won’t want to miss.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

25. The 8th Annual Walk of Fame Honoring Stevie Wonder (2002)

The 8th Annual Walk of Fame honors music icon Stevie Wonder with the prestigious BET Walk of Fame Award in this thrilling music special hosted by Jamie Foxx. The star-studded event, held in Washington D. C. , is filled with live performances and heartfelt tributes, celebrating the legendary R&B artist’s incredible impact on the African American music scene and culture. Get ready for an unforgettable night as Stevie Wonder takes his rightful place among the greatest African American musicians of all time.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

26. American Rap Stars (2002)

American Rap Stars, released in 2002, explores the intriguing world of hip hop through the lens of post-9/11 America. This fascinating documentary delves into the streets and extravagant lifestyles of the most influential voices in the industry, raising questions about the significance of rap music in today’s world.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

27. Shade (2003)

Shade” is a pulse-pounding crime thriller that takes you deep into the dangerous world of hustling and betrayal. Set in the vibrant backdrop of Los Angeles and Las Vegas, a group of skilled con artists led by the enigmatic “The Dean” execute an impressive heist on a vengeful gangster, unleashing a relentless pursuit that sends their lives spiraling out of control.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

28. Shaq’s All Star Comedy Roast 2 (2003)

Shaq’s All Star Comedy Roast 2", released in 2003, is a comedy special that brings together some of the biggest names in stand-up comedy for an evening filled with laughter and jabs. Directed by some of the top names in the industry, the film showcases the unique comedic styles of stars like Michael Colyar, Jamie Foxx, and Dick Gregory. The night is filled with dark comedy, making it an unmissable experience for fans of the genre.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

29. The 2003 Essence Music Festival (2003)

Join the energetic crowd at the 2003 Essence Music Festival, an iconic celebration of African-American culture and music. Held over three thrilling days at the Louisiana Superdome in New Orleans, this event brings together an awe-inspiring lineup of R&B and urban music stars. Witness electrifying performances by award-winning artists, including Yolanda Adams, Ashanti, and Steve Harvey.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

30. 4th Annual BET Awards (2004)

The fourth annual celebration of African-American achievement in film, television, music and sports, the 4th Annual BET Awards, returns in 2004. Hosted by the incredibly talented Mo’Nique, the event took place at the iconic Kodak Theater in Los Angeles, California on June 29, 2004. The awards show was broadcasted on the Black Entertainment Television cable channel, honoring the outstanding contributions of African-Americans in various fields of entertainment and beyond.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

31. Breakin’ All the Rules (2004)

Breakin’ All the Rules is a 2004 romantic comedy film starring Jamie Foxx, Gabrielle Union, and Morris Chestnut. Based on a man’s journey to heal after being dumped by his fiancée, the movie follows a newly-single man who decides to write a break-up manual for men.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

32. 2004 MTV Movie Awards (2004)

Get ready for a night of glitz, glamour, and unforgettable moments as the stars of Hollywood come together for the 2004 MTV Movie Awards! . This thrilling event, broadcast live on Music Television (MTV), celebrates the outstanding performances and achievements of big-time movie actors throughout the year.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

33. Collateral (2004)

Collateral, “ directed by Michael Mann and written by Stuart Beattie, is an exhilarating action-packed thriller that takes place on the bustling streets of Los Angeles. Tom Cruise portrays the role of Vincent, a contract killer on a mission, while Jamie Foxx plays Max, an unassuming cab driver who finds himself caught in the middle of these deadly rendezvous.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

34. Ray (2004)

Prepare for an unforgettable journey through the life of iconic singer and pianist Ray Charles in this powerful biographical drama. Ray (2004) captures the spirit and soul of the legendary rhythm and blues musician, from his gut-wrenching childhood blindness at age seven in the American South, to his inspiring ascent to fame during the 1950s and 1960s. Directed by Taylor Hackford and written by Hackford and James L.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

35. Redemption: The Stan Tookie Williams Story (2004)

Redemption: The Stan Tookie Williams Story delves into the life of Stan “Tookie” Williams, a notable figure in the world of gang violence. From his leadership in the “Crips” gang to his unexpected role as an advocate for peace and children’s welfare, this film follows Tookie’s transformative journey, detailing the impact of his life’s decisions and the consequences that awaited him.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

36. BET Comedy Awards (2004)

Get ready for a night of laughter and celebration! . The BET Comedy Awards, hosted by the dynamic Steve Harvey, honored the best in television and film comedy on September 28, 2004. Held at the beautiful Pasadena Civic Auditorium in Pasadena, California, and broadcasted live on the Black Entertainment Television network, this star-studded event showcased the hilarious talents of African American comedians and celebrated their achievements.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

37. Saturday Night Live: The Best of Cheri Oteri (2004)

Delve into an unforgettable 1990s journey of laughter with the talented and irresistibly charming Cheri Oteri. Combining the zany, side-splitting, and impeccable parody comedy of some of Saturday Night Live’s elite, “Saturday Night Live: The Best of Cheri Oteri” promises viewers an unrivaled experience of pure comedic gold.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

38. The 18th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (2004)

The 18th Annual Soul Train Music Awards” is a captivating celebration of music and achievements, honoring artists of color during 2003. Hosted by the talented Alicia Keys and pop icon Kenneth ‘Babyface’ Edmonds, this three-hour event brings together the best of African-American music and entertainment. Set in Los Angeles, California, the awards show features performances by renowned musicians like André 3000 and Rhona Bennett.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

39. 11th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards (2005)

As the curtain rises on the 11th Annual Screen Actors Guild Awards, audiences are treated to an unprecedented event where the most talented actors of the year call the shots. With a comprehensive list of 13 categories, the voting is in the hands of the stars, spanning across both television and film, showcasing the best performances of the year.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

40. Stealth (2005)

Stealth, “ a 2005 action-packed thriller, follows three elite pilots — Josh Lucas, Jessica Biel, and Jamie Foxx — as they find themselves deep in a top-secret military program. While struggling to control an artificial intelligence program, they must race against time to prevent the launch of a devastating missile attack that could trigger the next world war.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

41. 36th NAACP Image Awards (2005)

Experience the unforgettable 36th NAACP Image Awards in which outstanding achievements made by people of color in music, television, and motion pictures during 2004 are recognized. Hosted by the talented Chris Tucker, this star-studded ceremony brings together some of the most acclaimed individuals in the entertainment industry.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

42. The 77th Annual Academy Awards (2005)

Witness the glamour, excitement, and prestige of The 77th Annual Academy Awards, where the best of the film industry comes together to celebrate excellence in cinema. Hosted by the charismatic Chris Rock, the ceremony nominates critically acclaimed films such as The Aviator, Finding Neverland, Million Dollar Baby, Ray, and Sideways for prestigious awards.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

43. 2005 MTV Video Music Awards (2005)

Get ready for the ultimate pop music celebration with the 2005 MTV Video Music Awards! . This thrilling, star-studded TV special brings together some of the hottest artists in town to perform their chart-topping hits.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

44. Tsunami Aid: A Concert of Hope (2005)

Tsunami Aid: A Concert of Hope is a 2005 music television special that brought together some of the world’s most well-known artists in a heartfelt effort to help raise funds for the victims of the devastating tsunami disaster that occurred in 2004. This touching event, filled with powerful performances and heartfelt messages, featured stars like Ben Affleck, India Arie, and Drew Barrymore, showing their support and raising awareness about the urgent situation in the affected countries.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

45. Patriot Act: A Jeffrey Ross Home Movie (2005)

Patriot Act: A Jeffrey Ross Home Movie” is a compelling documentary that takes viewers behind the scenes of the United Service Organizations’ (USO) mission to provide entertainment to our troops. The film was inspired by the passing of legendary comedian Bob Hope and follows stand-up comedian Jeffrey Ross, the roast master at the Friars Club, as he goes on a mission to join the USO.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

46. Jarhead (2005)

Jarhead” is a drama-packed biographical war film that delves into the mind of a U. S. Marine sniper during the Gulf War. Directed by Sam Mendes, the movie provides an unforgettable insight into the psychological struggle faced by soldiers who are often left grappling with boredom, isolation, and turmoil back home.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

47. Kanye West: College Dropout — Video Anthology (2005)

Kanye West: College Dropout — Video Anthology” is a documentary music compilation that showcases the creative journey and inspiring music of the legendary rapper and artist Kanye West. This captivating anthology delves into Kanye’s rise in the hip-hop world and his unique ability to blend different genres and influences.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

48. 2006 American Music Awards (2006)

Prepare to be dazzled by the 34th annual American Music Awards, a star-studded event filled with electrifying live music performances and heart-pounding moments! . Tune in for a memorable night as Beyoncé, Jay-Z, Dixie Chicks, Lionel Richie, and many more take the stage to celebrate the world’s biggest and brightest artists. Don’t miss your chance to witness this unforgettable musical extravaganza in all its glory — the 2006 American Music Awards! .

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

49. The 78th Annual Academy Awards (2006)

Get ready for an unforgettable night of glamour, drama, and high stakes as you join host Jon Stewart for the 78th Annual Academy Awards! . This star-studded ceremony, broadcast in March of 2006, celebrates the year’s most iconic films, including “Brokeback Mountain, “ “Capote, “ “Crash, “ “Good Night, and Good Luck, “ and “Munich. “ As you tune in to witness the magic unfold, prepare yourselves for an evening filled with captivating performances, unexpected surprises, and an awe-inspiring tribute to the timeless power of cinema.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

50. Inside Man (2006)

Inside Man, directed by Spike Lee and written by Russell Gewirtz, is a thrilling crime drama that takes the audience on a suspenseful ride. Starring Denzel Washington as a bank robber, Clive Owen as a detective, and Jodie Foster as a high-power broker, the film follows a daring heist that spirals into a hostage situation. As the characters are drawn into high-stakes negotiations, they must navigate trust issues and work together to resolve the situation.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

51. BET Awards 2006 (2006)

Get ready to immerse yourself in a night filled with exhilarating performances, compelling stories, and awe-inspiring achievements. Join us as we take you inside the 6th Annual BET Awards of 2006, an unforgettable event that celebrates the triumphs and successes of African-Americans in the realms of television, film, music, and sports.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

52. 37th NAACP Image Awards (2006)

Step into the world of glamour, celebration, and talent at the 37th NAACP Image Awards, an event that highlights the outstanding achievements of people of color in the entertainment industry. Hosted by Cuba Gooding Jr. , this two-hour special, with an IMDb rating of 3.4, shines a spotlight on the hard work and dedication of these individuals in music, television, and motion pictures throughout 2005. Joining Cuba Gooding Jr.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

53. Miami Vice (2006)

Miami Vice is an action-packed, crime-infused thriller set in the sunny streets and beaches of Miami in the heart of the 1980s. Directed by the masterful Michael Mann, this film follows the lives of two vice detectives, Crockett and Tubbs, as their personal and professional lives become tangled in a dangerous web of crime and deception.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

54. The 20th Annual Soul Train Music Awards (2006)

Prepare for a night of unforgettable music and star-studded entertainment as ‘The 20th Annual Soul Train Music Awards’ makes its way to the Pasadena Conference Center in Pasadena, California. Hosted by the captivating duo of Vivica A. Fox and Nicole Richie, these awards aim to honor the incredible achievements made by African American musicians in 2005, celebrating their cultural significance and unwavering talent. Gather your friends and get ready to groove as this TV special delivers an electrifying blend of soul, R&B, and hip-hop.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

55. ATL (2006)

ATL, released in 2006, takes us on a rollercoaster ride through the lives of four high school friends as they navigate the challenges of life after graduation, set against the backdrop of their local rollerskating rink, Cascade. The film explores themes of friendship, ambition, and growing up, while weaving in elements of comedy, crime, and drama.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

56. Dreamgirls (2006)

Dreamgirls” (2006) is a musical drama that follows three African American women as they navigate their way to fame and fortune on the pop charts during the early 1960s. As the trio rises to success, they also confront personal struggles and the challenges of fame.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

57. Beef 4 (2007)

Beef 4" is a riveting documentary that digs deep into the world of hip hop, exploring the numerous feuds and beefs that have plagued the culture. From skateboarders and ball players, to actors and comedians, this film unveils the truth behind the most infamous beefs within and beyond the realm of Hip Hop.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

58. The Kingdom (2007)

In “The Kingdom” (2007), a group of elite U. S. government agents is sent on a mission to investigate the unthinkable — the bombing of an American facility in the Middle East. This action-packed thriller takes you on a whirlwind adventure as the team fights against time to uncover the truth.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

59. Saturday Night Live in the ’90s: Pop Culture Nation (2007)

Relive the magic of the 1990s with Saturday Night Live in the ’90s: Pop Culture Nation. This enlightening documentary delves into the heart of the iconic sketch comedy series as it navigated the pop culture landscape of the decade. With interviews from the cast and crew, along with the show’s host including stars like Alec Baldwin and Christina Aguilera, this film takes you behind the scenes of the beloved show and dissects the dynamic interactions that made it a cultural phenomenon.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

60. Life Support (2007)

Life Support” is a powerful drama film that tells the true story of a mother who overcomes a life-threatening addiction to crack cocaine and transforms herself into a beacon of hope and a passionate AIDS activist in the African American community. Based on the life of Hannah Weyer, the film showcases the resilience of the human spirit and the importance of social activism, particularly within marginalized groups.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

61. Made of Honor (2008)

In the heartwarming and comedic romantic comedy “Made of Honor, “ best friends Hannah (Michelle Monaghan) and Tom (Patrick Dempsey) share a one-of-a-kind bond. However, things take a surprising turn when Hannah reveals her engagement to a wealthy man, leaving Tom bewildered and heartbroken. To make matters even more complicated, Hannah asks Tom to be her maid of honor, setting the stage for an unforgettable and chaotic wedding ceremony.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

62. Dakota Skye (2008)

Dakota Skye, a 2008 drama filled with romance and mystery, follows the life of a young girl who possesses the extraordinary ability to perceive the truth behind people’s lies. As she navigates through the labyrinthine deceptions of New York City, she stumbles upon a boy who always speaks the truth, captivating her heart.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

63. We Are One: The Obama Inaugural Celebration at the Lincoln Memorial (2009)

We Are One: The Obama Inaugural Celebration at the Lincoln Memorial” captures the spirit of unity and hope as it documents the historic inauguration of President Barack Obama in 2009. This remarkable film, directed by Don Mischer and featuring an impressive lineup of stars, takes the audience on an inspiring journey through the festivities held at the iconic Lincoln Memorial.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

64. Law Abiding Citizen (2009)

Law Abiding Citizen” is a powerful and thrilling action-packed movie, released in 2009. It’s a story of intense justice gone rogue, following the life of a man deeply aggrieved by a plea bargain that set one of his family’s murderers free. This film explores the delicate balance between justice and revenge, featuring harrowing scenes involving physical torture and the ultimate act of retribution.

📺 Watch now free with Prime

🖼️ Check out these cool movie posters & art

65. The Neighborhood Ball: An Inauguration Celebration (2009)

Join the stars and the newly elected President Barack Obama at The Neighborhood Ball: An Inauguration Celebration, a 2009 TV special that aired after his historic inauguration. This two-hour concert film captivates audiences with top musical talent and entertainment, making it a must-watch for music enthusiasts and political history buffs alike.
